meanings.definition: A person who rocks back and forth.
meanings.sent1: The baby in the nursery is a little rockers.
meanings.sent2: Grandma loves being a rockers on her porch swing.
meanings.sent3: The rockers on the boat were having a rocking good time.
meanings.sent4: The old man in the park was a steady rockers on his bench.
meanings.sent5: The rockers on the seesaw were perfectly balanced.

meanings.definition: A type of chair with curved legs that allows it to rock back and forth.
meanings.sent1: The wooden rockers on the front porch creaked softly.
meanings.sent2: The nursery had a cozy rocking chair for the baby.
meanings.sent3: The rockers in the living room were always in motion.
meanings.sent4: The antique rockers in the museum were beautifully crafted.
meanings.sent5: The old man sat in the rockers, reminiscing about the past.

meanings.definition: A member of a subculture associated with rock music.
meanings.sent1: The rockers at the concert were dancing and singing along.
meanings.sent2: She dressed like a true rockers with leather jackets and band shirts.
meanings.sent3: The rockers in the band had wild hairstyles and tattoos.
meanings.sent4: The rockers on stage electrified the crowd with their music.
meanings.sent5: The rockers in the audience cheered for their favorite band.
